meanings.definition: Cause (an event or situation, typically one that is bad or undesirable) to happen suddenly, unexpectedly, or prematurely.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside precipitates fear in the small dog.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain precipitates flooding in low-lying areas.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected phone call precipitates chaos in the household.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions precipitate a chain of unfortunate events.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind precipitates the fall of the fragile tower.

meanings.definition: Cause (a substance) to be deposited in solid form from a solution.
meanings.sent1: The cooling of the liquid precipitates salt crystals at the bottom.
meanings.sent2: The addition of a chemical precipitates the formation of a new compound.
meanings.sent3: The experiment unexpectedly precipitates a beautiful crystal structure.
meanings.sent4: The slow evaporation process precipitates the growth of mineral deposits.
meanings.sent5: The sudden temperature change precipitates the solidification of the solution.
